item.title: Barplot with errorbar in ggplot2
item.description: Introduction Bar plots with error bars are very frequently used plots in sciences to represent the variation in a continuous variable within one or more categorical variables. Error bars give a general idea of how precise a measurement is, or conversely, how far from the reported value the true (error free) value might be. If the value displayed on your barplot is the result of an aggregation (like the mean value of several data points), you may want to display error bars.
